All jobs All Other Remote Revenue Operations Manager

Revenue Operations Manager

Posted 23 hours ago

Successful marketing requires precision, not noise. Statara brings together cutting-edge data science, insightful media buying, and powerful creative execution to deliver smart campaigns that move the needle. No middlemen, no wasted budget, and no guesswork required.

Apply now

Location: REMOTE - Must be US citizen residing in the US

Annual Salary Range - $75,000 - $80,000

The Revenue Operations Manager owns the operational engine behind Stataraâ€™s revenue and sales growth. This role leads Salesforce administration, revenue reporting infrastructure, and contract workflow coordination, serving as a cross-functional operator across Business Development, Finance, Legal, Product, and Activation.

This is a high-ownership role for a proactive, solutions-oriented operator who thrives in fast-moving environments and drives issues to resolution without waiting for direction.

CRM & Systems Ownership

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Serve as primary Salesforce administrator and internal CRM expert.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Own pipeline structure, deal stages, approval flows, automation, dashboards, and reporting architecture.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Enforce data hygiene standards and pipeline discipline across revenue-generating teams.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Continuously improve CRM processes to support scale, visibility, and accountability.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Train and enable team members on Salesforce and GTM tools to drive consistent adoption.

Revenue Reporting & Forecasting

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Build and maintain real-time dashboards covering pipeline, bookings, renewals, and revenue performance.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Support and improve weekly, monthly, and quarterly forecasting processes.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Partner with Finance to align CRM data with invoicing and revenue reporting.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Monitor pipeline progression, identify stalled deals, and proactively resolve bottlenecks.

Contract & Commercial Process Coordination

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Coordinate end-to-end contract workflows including MSAs, SOWs, amendments, and renewals.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Manage contract routing, redlines, approvals, and documentation across Sales, Legal, Finance, and leadership.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Maintain contract templates, pricing documentation, and approval workflows.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Track contract status to ensure timely execution and operational readiness.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Identify process gaps and implement practical improvements that increase speed and clarity.

Cross-Functional Operations

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Establish clear handoffs from closed deal through delivery and reporting.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Oversee operational workflows to ensure alignment and follow-through across teams.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Surface risks early and drive solutions across departments.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Act as a connective operator across HR, IT, Finance, and Legal.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Support leadership with execution tracking and operational accountability.

Â 

Requirements

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  4â€“7 years of experience in Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, Commercial Operations, or similar role.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Strong hands-on Salesforce experience (admin-level proficiency; able to build reports, dashboards, and workflows independently).

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Experience coordinating contract processes; familiarity with MSAs and SOWs preferred.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Comfortable working across Finance, Legal, Sales, and Product teams.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Experience in the data, ad tech, media, or technology industry strongly preferred.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Strong organizational skills with ability to manage multiple workstreams simultaneously.

Â 

Behavioral Profile

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Solutions-first mindset; brings recommendations, not just problems.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Strong critical thinker; able to infer context and connect dots with incomplete information.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  High energy with a strong sense of urgency.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Diplomatic and professional across stakeholders.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  High ownership and accountability; follows through to completion.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Resourceful and adaptable in a growing organization.

Â 

Benefits

We believe that a diverse, inclusive staff is a fundamental strength. Weâ€™re committed to hiring people of all races, ethnicities, religions, ages, sex, genders, sexual orientations, and gender identities. Women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, and members of untapped groups are strongly encouraged to apply and are welcome on our teams.
Â 
COMPETITIVE COMPENSATIONÂ 
Including a 401(k) with generous company matching.Â 
100% REMOTE WORKING OPPORTUNITY Â 
Always have been and always will be.Â 
TOP-NOTCH MEDICAL COVERAGEÂ 
Domestic-partner inclusive, health, dental, vision, life, cancer coverage, and long-term disability insurance for you and your dependents.Â 
GENEROUS PAID TIME OFFÂ 
23 days of PTO per year. Â We believe in work-life balance and encourage you to use your time off.Â 
PAID PARENTAL LEAVEÂ 
10 weeks of fully paid time off. All genders qualify equally, and the policy includes adoptions. Â

All jobs All Other Remote AI Evaluation Analyst

AI Evaluation Analyst

Posted 3 days ago

Toptal is an exclusive network of the top software developers, designers, marketing experts, management consultants, product managers, and project managers in the world. Top companies hire Toptal talent for their most important projects.

Apply now
Role Overview

Â The AI Evaluation Analyst is responsible for assessing the quality, performance, and reliability of AI systems and model outputs. This role supports the development and continuous improvement of AI products by analyzing results, identifying patterns, and providing structured feedback to technical and cross functional teams.

Key Responsibilities
  • Review and evaluate AI generated outputs for accuracy, relevance, safety, and consistency
  • Apply predefined evaluation frameworks, rubrics, and quality standards
  • Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis on model performance
  • Identify edge cases, failure patterns, and areas for improvement
  • Document findings clearly and provide actionable recommendations
  • Collaborate with data scientists, product teams, and engineers to refine models
  • Support testing cycles, experiments, and benchmarking initiatives
  • Maintain high attention to detail when handling sensitive or confidential data
Skills and Qualifications
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Ability to interpret guidelines and apply structured evaluation criteria
  • Excellent written communication and documentation abilities
  • Comfortable working with datasets, spreadsheets, and reporting tools
  • Familiarity with AI concepts such as machine learning, NLP, or large language models is a plus
  • Detail oriented, consistent, and able to manage repetitive review tasks
  • Ability to work independently while meeting quality and turnaround expectations
Preferred Background
  • Experience in quality assurance, data analysis, research, or content review
  • Exposure to AI products, prompt evaluation, model testing, or annotation workflows
  • Comfort working in fast evolving, experimentation driven environments

All jobs All Other Remote Senior DevOps Engineer (GCP)

Senior DevOps Engineer (GCP)

Posted 4 days ago

About us:Â 
Â 
Talent has no borders. Proxify's mission is to connect top developers around the world with the opportunities they deserve. So, it doesn't matter where you are; we are here to help you fast-track your independent career in the right direction.
Â 
Since our launch, Proxify's developers have successfully worked with 1200+ happy clients to build their products and growth features. 5000+ talented developers trust Proxify and its network to fulfill their dreams and objectives.
Â 
Proxify is shaped by a global network of supportive, talented developers interested in remote full-time jobs. Our Glassdoor (4.5/5) and Trustpilot (4.8/5) ratings reflect the trust developers place in us and our commitment to our members' success.
Â 
Apply now

The Role:

Â 

We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer specialising in GCP for one of our clients. You are a perfect candidate if you are growth-oriented, you love what you do, and you enjoy working on new ideas to develop exciting products.

Â 

What weâ€™re looking for:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a DevOps role, with substantial expertise in GCP cloud environments.
  • Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
  • Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) tools like Terraform, Ansible, or Google Deployment Manager.
  • Strong knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools, particularly Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Solid understanding of network architecture, security, and application development methodologies.
  • Proven ability to design and support robust build, deployment, and configuration management systems for multi-tier applications.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex infrastructure issues.
  • Effective communication skills, capable of handling multiple projects and priorities in a dynamic environment.
  • Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools such as Stackdriver, Prometheus, and Grafana.
  • Located in CET timezone (+/- 3 hours), we are unable to consider applications from candidates in other time zones.

Â 

Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and manage GCP-based cloud infrastructure to ensure optimal performance, reliability, and scalability.
  • Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for seamless deployment of applications and services.
  • Automate infrastructure provisioning and management using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or Google Deployment Manager.
  • Monitor and optimise cloud resources and applications to ensure high availability and performance.
  • Collaborate with software development teams to integrate DevOps practices into the development lifecycle.
  • Implement and manage security best practices for cloud environments.
  • Manage backup, disaster recovery, and business continuity planning.

Â 

What we offer:

Â 
Get paid, not played
No more unreliable clients. Enjoy on-time monthly payments with flexible withdrawal options.
Â 
Predictable project hours
Enjoy a harmonious work-life balance with consistent 8-hour working days with clients.
Â 
Flex days, so you can recharge
Enjoy up to 24 flex days off per year without losing pay, for full-time positions found through Proxify.
Â 
Career-accelerating positions at cutting-edge companies
Discover exclusive long-term remote positions at the world's most exciting companies.
Â 
Hand-picked opportunities, just for you
Skip the typical recruitment roadblocks and biases with personally matched positions.
Â 
One seamless process, multiple opportunities
A one-time contracting process for endless opportunities, with no extra assessments.
Â 
Compensation
Enjoy the same pay, every month with positions landed through Proxify.

Â 
Talent has no borders. Proxify's mission is to connect top developers around the world with the opportunities they deserve. So, it doesn't matter where you are; we are here to help you fast-track your independent career in the right direction.

Â

The Role:

Â 

We are looking for aÂ Senior Python AI EngineerÂ to join our fast-growing Network, who will design and develop backend systems and APIs for AI-powered applications. Â 

Â

Â

Â

  • LLM orchestration frameworks: LangChain, LangGraph, LlamaIndex.

  • Hands-on with LLMs & APIs: OpenAI (GPT-5/5-mini), Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini, Meta Llama, Mistral.
  • Familiarity with AWS Bedrock for accessing and deploying foundation models.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, product managers, and frontend developers to deliver end-to-end AI products.
  • Ensure performance, scalability, and cost optimization of AI solutions in production environments.
  • Monitor, evaluate, and continuously improve deployed AI systems.

Both roles

  • Build strong relationships with senior operations leadership to develop solutions for complex business issues.

  • Knowledge and experience in healthcare finance, financial modeling, and contracting methodology.

This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Paid Growth Lead in Mexico.
This role offers a unique opportunity to own and scale a high-impact paid acquisition engine in a fast-moving, remote-first environment. You will lead end-to-end paid growth strategy across major performance channels, combining creative excellence, data-driven experimentation, and AI-powered automation to drive sustainable user growth. Operating with a strong sense of ownership, you will manage budgets, experimentation velocity, and tooling to build systems that compound over time. The position demands both strategic thinking and hands-on execution, with a focus on rapid testing, fast iteration, and continuous optimization. You will collaborate closely with creative, content, and growth teams to translate insights into scalable campaigns. This is an ideal role for a builder who thrives in autonomy, embraces experimentation, and is passionate about shaping the future of digital growth.

Accountabilities:

    • Own end-to-end paid acquisition strategy and execution across major performance channels, including Meta, TikTok, and emerging platforms.
    • Manage budgets, channel prioritization, and campaign scaling decisions within defined guardrails.

    • Build and maintain high-velocity creative feedback loops that translate performance insights into scalable ad production.
    • Leverage AI tools, automation, and no-code solutions to accelerate creative production, analysis, and workflow efficiency.
    • Define and maintain data structures for performance tracking, experimentation, and decision-making using SQL and raw event data.
    • Lead and mentor the paid growth team, setting execution standards, improving speed, and fostering a culture of experimentation and accountability.
      • Requirements:
    • 4+ years of hands-on experience scaling paid acquisition in fast-paced, performance-driven environments.
    • Deep expertise in Meta Ads and TikTok, with experience across additional paid growth channels considered a strong advantage.
    • Strong SQL skills and comfort working directly with raw data and event-level tracking.
    • Proven ability to operate autonomously without reliance on centralized analytics teams.
    • High fluency with AI tools, automation platforms, no-code solutions, and AI agents for growth workflows.
    • Experience driving UGC and influencer-led creative production at scale.
    • Strong creative intuition combined with analytical rigor and a data-driven mindset.
    • Excellent communication, leadership, and organizational skills in remote, cross-functional settings.
      • Benefits:
    • Competitive compensation package with performance-based incentives.
    • Fully remote, flexible work environment.
    • Unlimited paid time off program.
    • Employee stock option plan.
    • Premium health, dental, and life insurance coverage.
    • Monthly stipend for wellness, fitness, learning, and personal development activities.
    • Extended parental and family leave policies.
    • Zero-fee access to internal financial and crypto tools.

Nice to have:

  • An existing audience or following in the English teaching space
  • Experience with video editing tools (CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, etc.)
  • Knowledge of YouTube and social media growth strategies

Compensation & Benefits

  • $42,000â€“$50,000 annual salary
  • Performance-based bonuses tied to content views and channel growth
  • 0.25% equity with a 4-year vesting schedule and 1-year cliff
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Fully remote â€” work from anywhere in the world
  • US-based employees: health and dental insurance reimbursement
